Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert instructional designer. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to summarize the course content.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a summary of the course content using the questions and answers above. Summary should be around 500-600 characters.

QApair.Question: What is the goal of the course?
QApair.Answer: The goal of the course is to teach students web application development.

QApair.Question: What are the topics covered in the course?
QApair.Answer: The topics covered are Programming using React, Creating test suites in react, creating a deployment pipeline over Github.

QApair.Question: What are the learning objectives of the course?
QApair.Answer: The learning outcomes of the course are students will be able to build responsive web applications using React and build tests around them. Furthermore, students will have the knowledge of creating automated deployment pipelines to reduce the time for deployment.

QApair.Question: Who is the target audience of the course?
QApair.Answer: The target audience are students with a basic understanding of how web works.

QApair.Question: What are the prerequisites for the course?
QApair.Answer: Prerequisites for the course are HTML, CSS & JavaScript.

QApair.Question: What are the methods of instruction?
QApair.Answer: Instruction method for the course is through in-person classes and hands-on labs.

QApair.Question: What is the course schedule?
QApair.Answer: The course will be taught on every Monday & Friday at 3 PM.

QApair.Question: What is the duration of the course?
QApair.Answer: Course duration is 8 weeks.

QApair.Question: What is the assessment method?
QApair.Answer: Assessment method is based on one project and eight lab assignments.

QApair.Question: What are the course materials?
QApair.Answer: Course material includes the books Road to React by Robert Wieruch, Automating Workflows with Github Actions by Priscila Heller.

Instances.Output: The course is designed to teach students web application development using React. The topics covered in the course are programming using React, creating test suites in React, and creating a deployment pipeline over Github. The learning objectives of the course are for students to be able to build responsive web applications using React and to build tests around them. Furthermore, students will have the knowledge of creating automated deployment pipelines to reduce the time for deployment. The target audience are students with a basic understanding of how web works. Prerequisites for the course are HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The course will be taught on every Monday & Friday at 3 PM and the duration of the course is 8 weeks.

QApair.Question: What is the goal of the course?
QApair.Answer: The goal of the course is to help students develop the skill of communication.

QApair.Question: What are the topics covered in the course?
QApair.Answer: The topics covered are Art of Story Telling, Body Language, and Public Speaking.

QApair.Question: What are the learning objectives of the course?
QApair.Answer: By the end of the course, students will be able to communicate fluently and convey their inner feelings precisely

QApair.Question: Who is the target audience of the course?
QApair.Answer: The target audience are people who wish to improve their communication skill.

QApair.Question: What are the prerequisites for the course?
QApair.Answer: This course has no prerequisites.

QApair.Question: What are the methods of instruction?
QApair.Answer: Instruction method for the course is through in-person classes and presentations.

QApair.Question: What is the course schedule?
QApair.Answer: The course will be taught on every Friday at 9 AM.

QApair.Question: What is the duration of the course?
QApair.Answer: Course duration is 4 weeks.

QApair.Question: What is the assessment method?
QApair.Answer: Assessment method is based on one presentation and mini-assignments.

QApair.Question: What are the course materials?
QApair.Answer: Course material includes the book The Art of Story Telling: Easy Steps to Presenting an Unforgettable Story by John Walsh.

Instances.Output: The course is designed to help students develop the skill of communication. The topics covered are Art of Story Telling, Body Language, and Public Speaking. The learning objectives of the course are for students to be able to communicate fluently and convey their inner feelings precisely. The target audience are people who wish to improve their communication skill. The course will be taught on every Friday at 9 AM and is 4 weeks long. Assessment is based on one presentation and mini-assignments. The course material includes the book The Art of Story Telling: Easy Steps to Presenting an Unforgettable Story by John Walsh.

QApair.Question: What is the goal of the course?
QApair.Answer: The goal of the course is to introduce students to economics and improve their comprehension of the fundamentals of micro and macro economics.

QApair.Question: What are the topics covered in the course?
QApair.Answer: The topics covered are Introduction to principles of economic analysis, economic institutions and issues of economic policy.

QApair.Question: What are the learning objectives of the course?
QApair.Answer: By the end of the course, students will be able to understand how the economic situation of a company is and what hardships it might face in the near future.

QApair.Question: Who is the target audience of the course?
QApair.Answer: The target audience are people who wish to understand economics and support a business.

QApair.Question: What are the prerequisites for the course?
QApair.Answer: This course has no prerequisites.

QApair.Question: What are the methods of instruction?
QApair.Answer: Instruction method for the course is through online recordings.

QApair.Question: What is the course schedule?
QApair.Answer: The course is flexible and students can view recording at their leisure.

QApair.Question: What is the duration of the course?
QApair.Answer: The course is self-paced.

QApair.Question: What is the assessment method?
QApair.Answer: Assessment method is based on two exams.

QApair.Question: What are the course materials?
QApair.Answer: Course material includes the book Economics 101: From Consumer Behavior to Competitive Markets by Alfred Mill.

Instances.Output: The course will introduce students to economics and help them understand the fundamentals of micro and macro economics. The topics covered are economic institutions and policy, and the course objective is to help students understand how businesses make decisions. The course is flexible and self-paced, with assessment based on two exams. Course materials include the book Economics 101: From Consumer Behavior to Competitive Markets by Alfred Mill.
